newsitem.title: USA: US Midwest direct hogs seen $0.50-$1 lower-dealers.
newsitem.headline: US Midwest direct hogs seen $0.50-$1 lower-dealers.

text.p: U.S. Midwest direct cash hog prices Thursday were seen $0.50 to $1.00 per cwt lower, pressured by a continued slide in pork product prices, livestock dealers said.
The lower pork prices pushed packer operating margins deeper into the red, they said.
Losses were furthered by larger-than-expected interior Iowa and southern Minnesota hog marketings on Tuesday and outlooks for hefty movement on Wednesday.
Interior movement Tuesday totalled 115,000 head, above the estimate of 110,000, USDA reported.
Interior hog movement on Wednesday was pegged at 105,000 head, although several hog dealers said actual receipts were likely above that level.
Midday ham prices were quoted steady to $2.00 per cwt lower, pork bellies were $3.00 lower and lean trimmings mostly off $6.00, USDA said in its central U.S. carlot pork report.

Interior Iowa and southern Minnesota top prices for hogs delivered to the plant were seen $59.00 to $59.50. Illinois top hog prices at the plant were seen $59.00 to $59.50 and Indiana/Ohio hogs were seen $59.00 at the plant.
